    question => UTF-8 string (378) "<p>7. Where the entity makes sales with a right of return, ensure that reven...
    $value[6]['question']
    <p>7.	Where the entity makes sales with a right of return, ensure that revenue is only recognised for the amount of consideration which the entity expects to be entitled to. </p>
<i>NB: Where consideration is received but the entity does not expect to be entitled to such amounts, this should be recognised as a refund liability.</i>
<i>See IFRS 15.B20 – 27 for guidance</i>

    question => string (432) "<h6>Allocating the transaction price</h6> <p>10. The transaction price shoul...
    $value[9]['question']
    <h6>Allocating the transaction price</h6>
<p>10.	The transaction price should be allocated to each performance obligation on a relative stand-alone selling price basis unless:</p>
<ul>
    <li>A discount is received by the customer for purchasing a bundle of goods or services; or</li>
    <li>There is variable consideration.</li>
</ul>
<p>Ensure that discounts and variable consideration have been treated appropriately.</p>

    question => string (651) "<h6>Recognising the revenue</h6> <p>11. Revenue should be recognised in acco...
    $value[10]['question']
    <h6>Recognising the revenue</h6>
<p>11.	Revenue should be recognised in accordance with the satisfaction of the performance obligations in the contract. </p>
<p>However, if a contract does not meet the criteria of IFRS 15.9, ensure that revenue has only been recognised when either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The entity has no remaining obligations to transfer goods or services to the customer and all, or substantially all, of the consideration promised by the customer has been received by the entity and is non-refundable; or</li>
    <li>The contract has been terminated and the consideration received from the customer is non-refundable.</li>
</ul>

    question => string (413) "<p>13. Ensure that costs incurred to fulfil a contract are only recognised a...
    $value[12]['question']
    <p>13.	Ensure that costs incurred to fulfil a contract are only recognised as an asset if:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The costs relate directly to a contract (see IFRS 15.97) that can be specifically identified;</li>
    <li>The costs generate or enhance resources of the entity that will be used in satisfying performance obligations in the future; and</li>
    <li>The costs are expected to be recovered. </li>
</ul>

    question => UTF-8 string (1040) "<p>14. IFRS 15 is applied using one of the following two methods: </p> <p>(a...
    $value[13]['question']
    <p>14.	 IFRS 15 is applied using one of the following two methods: </p>
<p>(a)	The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting i Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors</i> , subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 15.C5; or</p>
<p>(b)	The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 15 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. The entity may elect to apply IFRS 15 retrospectively only to contracts that are not completed contracts at the date of initial application.</p>
<i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2018 for a 31 December 2018 year end);</i>
<h6>Confirm which transition method is being used:</h6>

    question => UTF-8 string (1738) "<p>17. Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption ...
    $value[16]['question']
    <p>17.	Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 15. This should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>17.	Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 15. This should include:</li>
    <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption (e.g. accounting for refund liabilities);</li>
    <li>
        <p><strong><u>If the retrospective method has been used: </u></strong></p>
        <p>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 18/ IAS 11;</li>
            <li>Any reclassification adjustments made (e.g. showing contract assets separately);</li>
            <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 15 requirements;</li>
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li> 
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li>
        </ul>
        <p><i>(NB: IFRS 15.C4 states that the entity is only required to give this disclosure for the comparative period, but may wish to do so for earlier periods and/or the current period)</i></p>
    </li>
    <li>
        <p><strong><u>•	If the cumulative effect method has been used: </u></strong></p>
        <p>For the current period, an analysis of the amount by which each financial statement line item is affected by the application of this IFRS 15 as compared to IAS 11, IAS 18 and related Interpretations that were in effect before the change; and an explanation of the reasons for the significant changes. </p>
        <p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained.  </p>
    </li>
</ul>

    question => string (976) "<p>18. Obtain a breakdown of revenue disaggregated into categories that depi...
    $value[17]['question']
    <p>18.	Obtain a breakdown of revenue disaggregated into categories that depict how the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty if revenue and cash flows are affected by economic factors. </p>
<p>These categories may include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>type of good or service (for example, major product lines);</li>
    <li>geographical region (for example, country or region);</li>
    <li>market or type of customer (for example, government and non-government customers);</li>
    <li>type of contract (for example, fixed-price and time-and-materials contracts);</li>
    <li>contract duration (for example, short-term and long-term contracts);</li>
    <li>timing of transfer of goods or services (for example, revenue from goods or services transferred to customers at a point in time and revenue from goods or services transferred over time); and</li>
    <li>sales channels (for example, goods sold directly to consumers and goods sold through intermediaries)</li>
</ul>
